hevs.gdx2d.components.screen_management

Class RenderingScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • hevs.gdx2d.components.screen_management.RenderingScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GestureInterface, KeyboardInterface, TouchInterface

    public abstract class RenderingScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements KeyboardInterface, TouchInterface, GestureInterface
    Basic interface for all rendering screens
    Author:
    Pierre-Andr√© Mudry

      • onClick

        public void onClick(int x,
           int y,
           int button)
        Description copied from interface: TouchInterface
        Invoked when the pointer (mouse or touch) is pressed (once). The button parameter will be Input.Buttons#LEFT on Android.
        Specified by:
        onClick in interface TouchInterface
        Parameters:
        x - the screen X coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        y - the screen Y coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        button - Input.Buttons#LEFT or Input.Buttons#RIGHT button clicked

      • onDrag

        public void onDrag(int x,
          int y)
        Description copied from interface: TouchInterface
        Invoked when the pointer (mouse or touch) is moved and down.
        Specified by:
        onDrag in interface TouchInterface
        Parameters:
        x - the screen X coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        y - the screen Y coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)

      • onFling

        public void onFling(float velocityX,
           float velocityY,
           int button)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Called when the user dragged a finger over the screen and lifted it. Reports the last known velocity of the finger in pixels per second.
        Specified by:
        onFling in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        velocityX - velocity on x in seconds
        velocityY - velocity on y in seconds
        button - Input.Buttons#LEFT or Input.Buttons#RIGHT button clicked

      • onLongPress

        public void onLongPress(float x,
               float y)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Called on long press on Android.
        Specified by:
        onLongPress in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        x - the screen X coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        y - the screen Y coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)

      • onPan

        public void onPan(float x,
         float y,
         float deltaX,
         float deltaY)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Called when the user drags a finger over the screen on Android.
        Specified by:
        onPan in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        x - the screen X coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        y - the screen Y coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        deltaX - the difference in pixels to the last drag event on x
        deltaY - the difference in pixels to the last drag event on y

      • onPinch

        public void onPinch(Vector2 initialPointer1,
           Vector2 initialPointer2,
           Vector2 pointer1,
           Vector2 pointer2)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Called when a user performs a pinch zoom gesture on Android. Reports the initial positions of the two involved fingers and their current positions.
        Specified by:
        onPinch in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        initialPointer1 - finger 1 initial position
        initialPointer2 - finger 2 initial position
        pointer1 - finger 1 current position
        pointer2 - finger 2 current position

      • onRelease

        public void onRelease(int x,
             int y,
             int button)
        Description copied from interface: TouchInterface
        Invoked when the pointer (mouse or touch) is released. The button parameter will be Input.Buttons#LEFT on Android.
        Specified by:
        onRelease in interface TouchInterface
        Parameters:
        x - the screen X coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        y - the screen Y coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        button - Input.Buttons#LEFT or Input.Buttons#RIGHT button clicked

      • onScroll

        public void onScroll(int amount)
        Description copied from interface: TouchInterface
        Invoked when the mouse scroll (wheel) has been moved.
        Specified by:
        onScroll in interface TouchInterface
        Parameters:
        amount - the scroll amount, -1 or 1 depending on the direction the wheel was scrolled

      • onTap

        public void onTap(float x,
         float y,
         int count,
         int button)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Invoked for a tap gesture on Android. A tap happens if a touch went down on the screen and was lifted again without moving outside of the tap square.
        Specified by:
        onTap in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        x - the screen X coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        y - the screen Y coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        count - the number of taps
        button - Input.Buttons#LEFT or Input.Buttons#RIGHT button clicked

      • onZoom

        public void onZoom(float initialDistance,
          float distance)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Called when the user performs a pinch zoom gesture on Android. The original distance is the distance in pixels when the gesture started.
        Specified by:
        onZoom in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        initialDistance - distance between fingers when the gesture started
        distance - current distance between fingers

      • onKeyDown

        public void onKeyDown(int keycode)
        Description copied from interface: KeyboardInterface
        Invoked when a key is typed. Use Input.Keys to read the key code.
        Specified by:
        onKeyDown in interface KeyboardInterface
        Parameters:
        keycode - the code key, see Input.Keys

      • onKeyUp

        public void onKeyUp(int keycode)
        Description copied from interface: KeyboardInterface
        Invoked when a key is released. Use Input.Keys to read the key code.
        Specified by:
        onKeyUp in interface KeyboardInterface
        Parameters:
        keycode - the code key, see Input.Keys

        public void dispose()
